title: UX Designer
description: Ethyca (https://ethyca.com) is a high-growth Series A remote startup on a mission to make Trust, Respect and Privacy a default feature of every tech stack. To accomplish this, we created the Fides open source language for data privacy (https://ethyca.com/fides/) and its related suite of free developer tools to enforce privacy policies as code, automate users‚Äô right to access and erase their data, and much more. We believe software engineers are uniquely equipped to solve modern privacy challenges, but only if we work together on shared standards and best practice tools - come join our team and help make this a reality!As Ethycas inaugural UX designer, you‚Äôll be responsible for designing our developer experiences from the initial mockups all the way through the front-end framework, and consulting on implementation. As a member of the product team, you‚Äôll help to distill product requirements into low- or high-fidelity wireframes and facilitate a seamless transition to implementation with the engineering team. Your super power is understanding complex engineering concepts and translating them into a user experience for non-technical users across any enterprise vertical: lawyers, product managers, and business operations resources. This is not an entry-level role, as you will need to understand human-to-computer interaction for a new product that is unlike any that current exist today. What you will do Champion UX best practices to ensure we‚Äôre all making informed design decisions together. Work with product and engineering team to craft achievable design solutions using your experience (or dribbble and codepen search skills!) that can be implemented quickly and will lead to immediate value for the user community. Build prototypes, wireframes and high-fidelity mockups using design tools like Invision, Figma and Sketch to workshop and develop on requirements. Build prototypes or bootstrap components using React or Angular to help convey an idea to other engineers and stakeholders. Analyze KPIs to identify underlying trends, develop hypotheses, test and evaluate new iterations of design systems and UX. Occasionally, work with the product team to perform UX research studies, help develop product roadmap, and soundboard product marketing ideas. Who you are A former or current engineer, or just an engineer at-heart. You have at least 3 years of experience implementing front-end web technologies (oo js, react, angular etc) and against web standards including html5 and css3. A skilled designer and eager to learn. You have at least 4 years experience designing and building product experiences for end-users and have shipped design for a product used by a significant user base. You have a have a strong understanding of user-centered design and product thinking when making design decisions, and you back that understanding with compelling design solutions. You are able to quickly build up an understanding of all experiences and touch points that go into delivering value to our customers. An empathetic interaction designer. You craft high quality, end to end experiences. You build straightforward user flows, information architecture, and utilize the tenants of strong interaction design in your work. You leverage design systems for consistency and pay attention to the details of each screen. You work with engineers to ship experiences that are usable and aesthetically pleasing. Firm believer in user-centered design thinking. At Ethyca, our users are lawyers, business operations, and engineers; your being an engineer and bridging compliance/privacy needs with design for a diversity of user types is instrumental to the success of the product. You enjoy learning from customers and team members, and you‚Äôre comfortable participating in research regularly to test, clarify or validate assumptions. You know how to measure the results of your work and understand its downstream effects on users and compliance rqeuirements. A skilled written communicator. You are comfortable writing some in-product copy and light technical education materials. You believe in the power of succinct, efficient copy for the product as a part of the user experience. Your excellent communication style (verbally and written) to internal product, engineering and design teams should bring clarity and direction to conversations. We are hiring US-based candidates for this remote role with a preference toward candidates in the NYC area as the role will require East coast working hours.Benefits Competitive cash + equity compensation 100% medical and dental insurance coverage Flexible office hours & vacation policy Parental leave 401K About EthycaWe are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do not discriminate on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other protected characteristics.Ethyca is a distributed team with headquarters in NYC and remote workers across the US. When it‚Äôs safe to meet again, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to travel to NYC a few times a year for company events. We are currently unable to sponsor visas so require that you are authorized to work in the USA.We‚Äôre an engineering company building a missing piece of the Internet‚Äôs infrastructure: the trust layer that empowers users and businesses to manage data respectfully. Every day, we‚Äôre solving challenges for customers and thinking about the future of human rights as society increasingly moves online. If this sounds intriguing and you‚Äôre excited to shape that future with us, we‚Äôd love to talk to you!

title: Brand Design
description: Free Agency is a talent startup modernizing how people find & succeed at work. We provide concierge services and digital products to knowledge workers, mirroring Hollywood-style talent representation and management. Unlike recruiters, we‚Äôre entirely paid by and motivated by the individual candidates we work with, enabling us to focus on their career outcomes. Their success is our success.We‚Äôve started with the tech industry: through our platform, mid to C-level folks in product, engineering, design, marketing, and ops are doing incredible work at companies like Square, Drift, Roblox, Reddit, Netflix, Amazon, SpaceX, Notion, Peloton, and hundreds more. We‚Äôre backed by top-tier venture capital firms like Resolute Ventures, Bloomberg Beta, and Ludlow Ventures.About the job:Were looking to engage an incredible brand designer to help us refresh our overall brand style. This is specifically not about our logo, which we love and intend to keep, but instead about everything else related to our visual presence.The ideal designer should have significant time to dedicate to the project, as we want to be on the other side of our brand refresh on a relatively short timeframe without sacrificing quality. This is a remote role and we intend to pay hourly to enable iterative work, design feedback, and a dynamic scope.You will work with the co-founder & CEO on: Overall brand style and visual themes, including color scheme, logo usage, fonts, photography, and general treatment. Graphic direction (other designers are available to contribute), including iconography and data visualization. Visual design exploration, including web layout, one-pager + deck design, social images, and blog design. At the end of our time together, Free Agency should have an incredible brand design and style guide to use. If its of mutual interest, we will continue to engage strong designers for continued work, consulting on one-off projects, and adjacent needs (print + swag).Here are some things we care about when it comes to design: Were a consumer-facing service but with a high ticket price. Therefore, we want to be both welcoming (warm) and trustworthy (serious), which can be a hard balance to strike. Sleek comes to mind. We work with people and companies in the tech industry, including the latest + greatest startups. It is important for our design to be modern and provide a sense of zeitgeist & recency. We arent looking for very rigid design -- in other words, when it comes to our overall palette, we think its great when brands do ad campaigns or fun social graphics that stretch beyond what they use on their landing page. If Free Agency, our brand, and our intention sound intriguing, wed love to hear from you.

title: Design Coach
description: About MentoMento is a career tech company. We‚Äôre on a mission to provide people access to to the best career advice in the world, and empower them take action on it. In a world where jobs and careers are rapidly changing, were equipping people with the products, information, and support to build and maintain meaningful careers.We strive to create a fun, conscientiousness, collaborative, and supportive work environment, and are looking for several team members to join us! We are a remote-first company based in the US and Europe with over $5.5M raised from VCs including Twelve Below, M13, Slow Ventures, NextGen VP, and AngelList Quant, among others.About The RoleWe are looking for a career coach to specialize in supporting Product and Graphic Design professionals. From working with them on their daily work, to their broader career goals, you will support professionals throughout all aspects of their careers.Your day-to-day responsibilities will include: Serving as the main point of contact for our users. Providing 1:1 coaching, feedback, and support through virtual sessions as well as text, email, etc. Support professionals through group coaching and one-to-many sessions. Asynchronous feedback and review on content and materials. Working with the Mento team to improve the product and user experience Being an integral member of the coaching team ‚Äî helping enhance our coaching practices and developing materials to deliver an incredible user experience and fulfill our mission of helping people thrive in jobs that they love. Acting with kindness and respect as an ambassador and representative of the Mento community Who are you? Passionate about helping people advance in the workplace, and find and build fulfilling careers. 5+ years experience working in the tech industry in Design or a Creative position! Ideally, you have experience working as a career coach (though coaching certificates are not required!). A high EQ person with acts with empathy and can create a safe space for people. You understand that there are glorious and not so glorious aspects to any job. We are a startup and we all wear many hats! Comfortable with navigating ambiguity! Other details This is a part-time position paid hourly with performance bonus. You must have bandwidth to put minimum 5 hours per week towards Mento. We will start with a 6-month initial commitment, more is great. Remote position. Candidates are preferably US-based. üî• Apply for this role! We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. We truly don‚Äôt care about your credentials! If you‚Äôre passionate about helping more people access sustainable, better paid careers, we want to hear from you.

title: Senior Designer
description: Harley & Co. is an award-winning, internationally recognized creative and entertainment studio that specializes in media properties, experiences, identity design and narrative content. We work at the crossroads of audio/video series, campaigns, physical installations and graphic design. We are looking for a senior designer who is creative, talented with an eye for typography, design and layout. The senior designer should be someone who loves to use design to tell complex stories that shift culture. They should have a passion for film, photography, typography and contemporary ways to apply graphic design. They should believe that design, if used well, can be a transformative tool for change. This job requires someone who is endlessly curious and loves learning new things. You should bring proficient skills within the Adobe Suite (Photoshop and Illustrator, InDesign required) C4D and after effect knowledge is a plus as you will be creating design assets across multiple platforms. The company currently operates on a remote basis with all employees and has a centrally located headquarters in New York City. Responsibilities: ¬∑ Easily adapt and add to our company philosophy ‚Äì think differently, constantly evolve/elevate your work, inspire the team, and lead by example getting hands on with the work¬∑ Come from a mindset of earning your spot. Developing big ideas within practical considerations that connect to culture.¬∑ Collaborate with our Creative Director and Senior Art Director to execute brand vision for our clients¬∑ Have strong understanding of how to shape narratives, and an appreciation for strategic thinking¬∑ Get into the details, review & refine briefs, understand project plans & staffing, and be constantly thinking about how to set the team up for success What You Bring:‚óè Bachelor Degree in Design, minimum 5-7 years of experience‚óè Comfort working across discipline‚óè Proficiency in Adobe Suite - Photoshop and Illustrator required - InDesign, and After Effects a plus.‚óè Print experience with strong typography and layout skills‚óè Ability to take feedback and learn from experts in the field of design and creative thinking What We Value:‚óè Compassion: Empathy for the people our work supports and our colleagues‚óè Curiosity: A continuous ambition to learn and apply new knowledge/techniques cross platforms‚óè Adaptability: Ability to wear multiple hats and working outside of your comfort zone‚óè Composure & Poise: A level-minded demeanor through client feedback and fast working conditions

title: Lead Product Designer
description: About TixTrackTixTrack is re-inventing the way live entertainment companies and attractions sell tickets to their events. Our software is used by industry leaders such as The Walt Disney Company, Cirque du Soleil, Meow Wolf and The Rock & Roll Hall of Fame. Through our platforms, we‚Äôll sell over $1 billion dollars in tickets in 2022. Our products have been driving tremendous growth for our customers sales and, as a result, TixTrack is now experiencing our fastest growth ever. We‚Äôre looking for a great Lead Designer to help continue our success!The PositionThis is a rare opportunity to join a fast-growing tech company as the lead designer for our live entertainment ticketing system. You will help transform the ticketing industry by designing a ticket buying process that both increases sales and is pleasant for ticket buyers. In this role you will collaborate with founders, product managers, engineers and customers to design simple, user-friendly and beautiful designs for all things TixTrack including the UI for our web-based software.Requirements Experience creating highly intuitive and beautiful user interfaces across a variety of environments (web apps, dashboards, e-commerce, mobile etc.) Introduce UI patterns and best practices which ultimately define TixTrack‚Äôs visual language. A passion for solving complex problems while owning all aspects of the design (user experience, visual & interaction design). Excellent design skills using tools like Figma. Experience designing re-usable web component libraries for front end frameworks like React, Vue or Angular. Keen understanding of color theory, web typography, and user psychology. An online portfolio with an outstanding body of work that demonstrates experience designing intuitive web-based interfaces. Other nice to haves: Ability to code HTML/CSS/SASS/LESS. Experience designing for e-commerce, enterprise software or mobile apps. QualificationsA bachelors degree in a design-related discipline such as graphic design, human-computer interaction or communications is preferred.Benefits and Work EnvironmentThis is a remote position in a remote-first company. Although we are serious about success, we strive for a fun and friendly work environment where everyone enjoys their job. TixTrack is a young company, but unlike many companies of our size, we are already profitable. Competitive salary and equity opportunities. Full healthcare benefits (Medical PPO, Dental, Vision). Generous paid vacation and holidays. 401K.

title: UI/UX Designer
description: About Us: Lessonface.com is a vibrant online platform that connects music and arts enthusiasts of all ages with expert teachers for immersive and inspiring learning experiences, called by the LA Times the best option for teaching music online. For over ten years, we have been committed to fostering a creative & equitable environment where music and art students and teachers meet and interact, and we have a large and growing truly enthusiastic community as a result. Now, were seeking a talented UI/UX Designer to join our bootstrapped team on a contract basis and take our platform to new heights.Role Overview: As UI/UX Designer, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing the user experience on Lessonface.com. There is near-infinite room for impact in our expanding universe filled with enthusiastic users on both the student and teacher sides. You will be a key part of a small, passionate and engaged team improving our music and arts education platform. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with leadership to conceptualize and execute design solutions. Update and improve the existing user interface, creating designs that may reference modern design trends, but are not solely trendy, nor generic. Design and prototype new features that enhance user engagement and satisfaction, ensuring a consistent and intuitive experience. Assess user research and help to gather feedback to inform design decisions, incorporating user insights into your designs. Develop wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes to illustrate design concepts and workflows. Ensure responsive design principles are applied, allowing for a seamless user experience across various devices and screen sizes. Participate in usability testing and iterate on designs based on user feedback, striving to continuously improve the user experience. Qualifications: Proven experience as a UI/UX Designer, with a portfolio showcasing your design skills and creative problem-solving abilities. Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, or similar software. Strong understanding of user-centered design principles, with an ability to translate user needs into elegant design solutions. Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and basic JavaScript concepts, enabling effective communication with development teams. Excellent communication skills and a collaborative, self-motivated mindset to work effectively, without a lot of oversight, within a fairly flat team environment. Familiarity with the latest design trends, interaction patterns, and user experience best practices, ultimately moderated with an core appreciation for timeless concepts that transcend trends. Appreciation for great teachers and music and arts education. Contract Details: Duration: Ongoing Location: Remote Compensation: $40-$100/hr, for 10-20 hours a week, depending on your experience level and availability Start Date: September 15, 2023 Join us in shaping the future of online music and arts education. If youre a passionate UI/UX Designer with an eye for detail, a dedication to user-centric design, and appreciation for the inspiration and guidance of great teachers, apply now and lets create something exceptional together!To apply, please submit your resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter outlining your design philosophy and relevant experience to hr@lessonface.com.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: CTC is a remote-first SaaS company backed by AirTree ventures, we‚Äôre out to build the best tax software for the web3 world. We have challenging design problems, an extremely capable engineering team and an unwavering commitment to building the best possible designs for our customers. We offer top-of-market compensation and real work-life balance, with a 100% remote-friendly environment, flexible work hours, minimal meetings, and a wide variety of work. We are proud to have built a team culture that people genuinely enjoy working in.Job descriptionGet exposed to challenging and unique design problems that have never been solved before. You will have the opportunity to touch every aspect of the user experience and implement cutting edge designs, creating genuinely new and innovative experiences. We are all-in on taking chances to create the best, most remarkable product in our space. We have a high bar for design execution and expect our designers to be involved in every facet of the business. The product design team is responsible for the end-to-end customer experience with CTC. From our marketing website, through to every journey and detail within the product. You‚Äôll be a core member of the product team, working directly with the founder and lead product designer. You‚Äôll have a direct and frequent impact on the future of the product.Why you should work for us Competitive top-of-market package VC-backed fast growing SaaS company Remote-first company ‚Äì we don‚Äôt care where you work Flexible work hours ‚Äì we don‚Äôt care when you work Async-first ‚Äì we only have one internal meeting day, the rest are meeting free days so you can actually get work done. High velocity team ‚Äì we work hard and ship fast Challenging design problems that often have never been solved before. Everything we do is geared towards maximising throughput and minimising BS Work with an exceptional and passionate team. About you: Excels when working in a lean team environment with many projects running in parallel Can take rough ideas from concepts, through research, to polished designs ready for development Can conduct end to end research initiatives to discover and validate design concepts Can influence the shape of the product through research and data execute designs using wireframes, user journeys, interactive prototypes and high fidelity visual designs Has extremely refined and polished visual design skills Partners with engineers and others to ensure a high-quality implementation Has experience building highly refined figma components and maintaining design systems Has knowledge of HTML/CSS, and experience working with engineering teams to ensure accurate implementation of designs Prides themselves on well executed, polished experiences What you will do Contribute to the overall product and design direction of the company Work cross functionally with engineers and other partners Come up with features and improvements that ship quickly with high quality Evolve our internal design system Create flows, prototypes and high-fidelity visuals Help with hiring and establishing a design culture within the company Conduct customer interviews and usability tests What we value Passion about design, figuring out best-in-class solutions to complex problems Excellent verbal and written communication skills Passion for technology, the future and strategy Compassion for our customers Resilience in the face of challenges Strong beliefs, loosely held A good working knowledge of crypto and web3 or a background in tax, fintech or data intensive products is nice to have Must have 5+ years in product design Portfolio of past work Highly refined and polished design style Experience in B2C and B2B SaaS products Experience working for a product-focused tech company If you are a highly motivated, passionate and organized individual who is looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity, we encourage you to apply.

title: Principal/Lead Product Designer
description: About Us:Fello is not just reshaping the real estate industry; were revolutionizing it. With our innovative, high-tech tools, we empower agents and teams to excel in a rapidly changing market. As a VC-backed startup already witnessing tremendous growth, Fello offers an exciting opportunity for forward-thinking individuals to be part of our success story. If you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of web design to create intuitive user experiences, we want to hear from you!About You:We want a Principal Product Designer who can turn the most complex into the most user-friendly. Your mission? Craft pixel-perfect interfaces across our web applications that our users will love. Your expertise in both UX and UI design will help us craft high-quality, user-friendly interfaces across our web applications, bridging the gap between complexity and functionality.This is a remote role with the option to work anywhere in India.You Will: Conceptualize and design high-quality, pixel-perfect mockups and interactive prototypes that align with specific business and client needs while meeting deadlines Create UI comps, interactive prototypes, pattern sets, design specs, and assets for usability testing and live production environments to develop high/low fidelity clickable prototypes, storyboards, and a wide range of UI assets and deliverables Be a passionate advocate for the user, ground ideas in data-driven solutions by partnering with our product team to incorporate customer insights Drive the design process to produce solutions that balance user needs, business goals, and analytical wisdom Identify the best design methods to articulate your solutions (flows, prototypes, wireframes, high-fidelity design, etc.) Work in collaboration with key project team members including product managers, tech leads, developers, strategy, and UX to drive the best digital experiences through all phases of product development You Have: 5+ years of product experience designing user interfaces for desktop, website, and mobile applications BA/BS or equivalent experience A proven history of experience in design, ideally from within mature product development organizations Experience across all phases of the product design process ‚Äî ideation, user research, prototyping, and high-fidelity design Proficiency in product design tools, such as Figma, Sketch Experience as the primary or lead designer on product design projects from end to end Ability to work at the level of detail appropriate for the audience and project phase ‚Äî you know when to show napkin sketches and to whom you should show polished high-fidelity mock-ups Excellent communication skills: you are articulate and communicate design decisions well to varied partners Our Benefits: Great compensation package Flexible PTO Excellent health benefits

title: Lead UI/UX SaaS Product Designer
description: Company Overview: At Praetorian, our vision is to create a future without compromise and our mission is to prevent breaches before they occur. By emulating attackers, we uncover the materials risks that lead to compromise before hackers are aware they exist. From cryptocurrency exchanges to autonomous vehicles and from medical device platforms to space telescopes, we leverage offensive security to instill a prevention first strategy in our customers. Career opportunity: Join an industry with massive socio, economic, and political importance in the 21st century Work alongside some of the best and the brightest minds in the security industry Work with prominent clients and help them solve hard security problems Leave an indelible mark on a company where individual input has a real impact Align your career trajectory with a hyper-growth company that is on the move Core responsibilities: Own and set the design direction of the product Translate user pain and customer problems into intuitive and elegant design solutions Combine core design principles with individual creativity to bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design problems Apply b2c design philosophies to b2b software with a mantra that beautiful design can help differentiate a product and win a market Leverage design as a way to communicate the vision, roadmap, and future state of the product Architecture and implement new designs as well as optimize existing designs Create initial low res wireframes, high fidelity mock-ups and interactive prototypes for presentation and feedback prior to implementation Interviews users, collect input, analyze activity, and incorporate feedback into final design products Desired qualifications: 5+ years of relevant design experience Prior experience launching software-as-a-service products in fast-paced start-up environments Proven success designing and optimizing high-quality product experiences in B2C or B2B saas platforms Demonstrated mastery of ui/ux interaction, design principles, and deliverables Expertise in rapid prototyping, concept diagrams, user scenarios, wireframes, flows, experience maps, design patterns and annotated comps. Additional +1 qualifications: Referenceable portfolio of prior work Experience with material design Experience with Balsamiq, Figma, JIRA, Mixpanel, and Productboard a plus Desired behaviors: Comfortable operating as a team of one with total ownership of the problem space Strong work ethic with a relentless restlessness for constant improvement Strong relationship orientation and ability to thrive in a user-obsessed environment Ability to helicopter up and down between strategic product objectives and tactical conversations Genuine interest and intellectual curiosity of the theory behind elegant ui/ux design Lead by example and drives performance with an aim of continuous improvement

title: Sr Product Designer-Digital Collectibles
description: Who We Are Angel Studios is the home of stories that amplify light. Through its platform, thousands of ‚ÄúAngel‚Äù investors choose which titles will be created, funded, and distributed. Angel Studios allows creators and audiences to form passionate communities around their creative projects, making the story behind the story as important as the final project itself. The studios‚Äô first projects‚ÄîThe Chosen and Dry Bar Comedy‚Äîhave earned billions of views around the world. Learn more at Angel.comWe‚Äôre looking for passionate team members who want to build world-class products that will reshape media over the coming decades. Learn more about:Our North StarCompany StrategyTeam PrinciplesJoin us and be part of stories that matter.Summary/objective:We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Product Designer who excels at distilling complex ideas into simplified, intuitive, and user-friendly solutions. You will face exciting challenges, exploring innovative ideas in the media space, helping users to benefit each other, and creating empowering dashboard experiences for users. Your designs will seamlessly adapt to various screens, align with platform requirements, and directly impact user satisfaction. You will need to clearly communicate your design solutions to engineers to ensure the accuracy of your vision is translated correctly into production.Essential functions Distilling complex ideas into simplified, intuitive, and user-friendly solutions that captivate and engage. Face exciting challenges that require you to come up with innovative ideas never before explored in the media space. Create dashboard-type experiences that empower users to seamlessly access information from multiple sources. Design solutions that seamlessly adapt to various screen sizes and breakpoints, ensuring compatibility across mobile apps, web platforms, and occasional TV usage. Foster coordination and collaboration with each platform team, ensuring your design solutions align with the unique requirements of each platform. Propose elegant solutions is of utmost importance as it directly impacts user satisfaction with the final product. Must attend and contribute to regularly scheduled staff meetings.Proficiency in speaking, reading and writing in the English language required. Additional language proficiency is a plus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.Competencies An exceptional listener with excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficiency with Microsoft Office and Google Workspace. Detail-oriented perspective and able to pick up on overlooked details. Organization and time management. Able to maintain confidentiality of information. Must be able to manage multiple assignments, set priorities, and adapt to changing conditions. Resourceful and able to problem-solve and manage tasks with ambiguity. Willing to perform an array of tasks both in and out of the office. Can take feedback to tasks and assignments positively and create better solutions. A quick study, able to pick up new skills and learn how to use new programs. Must participate in setting and achieving regularly scheduled and outlined objectives. Ability to take individual ownership, execute with high energy, share context, insist on candor with positive intent. Proficient with Figma as your primary design platform. Strong understanding of design systems and design tokens. Ability to assist in coordinating, updating, and managing design system components that are adopted into production.

title: Graphic Designer/Illustrator
description: OverviewDopple is looking for an illustration-focused designer to help establish a new graphic illustration style and execute illustrations, imagery, charts, and possibly animations and videos in that style. The style should embody the visual positioning of Dopple‚Äôs brand as a dynamic 3D platform for realistic, interactive, configurable product representations.Dopple‚Äôs creative director will collaborate with you on concepts, review your work and give feedback on any adjustments needed. You will work with members of the Dopple marketing team to align visual plans with written content and to get source imagery (3D model renderings and recordings from Babylon or Adobe 3DS Max).This role is part-time, contract, remote. When applying Include portfolio links Include working hours (overlapping with EST time zone) Requirements & Nice-to-haves Ability to concept and execute visuals with high aesthetic quality Provide graphics with transparent backgrounds to allow flexible use Understanding of how visual details contribute to brand Take creative direction and incorporate feedback Provide original layered illustration files that can be edited by Dopple team in Adobe Creative Suite Ability to plan and create motion graphics, videos, animations (preferred) Understanding of 3D and Augmented Reality design (preferred) Front-end development ability (preferred)

title: Designer
description: Company DescriptionMechanism is an early-stage venture firm that partners with entrepreneurs to launch and scale ambitious companies.In our model, we work to identify and validate opportunities before creating every business. We then provide the growth expertise to gain early traction as well as the business support to establish positive unit economics, profitability, and scale.In addition to investment and strategic guidance, we offer extensive operational support for our startups in critical areas, including Growth, Product, Design, Operations, People, Finance, and Legal. Our in-house experts are at the top of their fields and are here to provide world-class support and expertise helping our startups get off the ground and scale.As a team, we have deep expertise across growth marketing, and it‚Äôs an important part of our company-wide culture. When it comes to launching and scaling companies, we don‚Äôt guess. We engineer.Our success rate of getting companies profitable is 100%, and our team has a track record of investing in and cofounding multiple companies with $100M+ revenue.Position DescriptionWe are seeking a talented and experienced freelance designer with a strong focus on revenue growth, branding, and marketing design. In this role, you will be responsible for creating visually stunning and user-friendly digital touchpoints that drive conversions and support our growth marketing initiatives. Your expertise in both design principles, branding, and marketing strategies will be essential in elevating our portfolio companies‚Äô online presence and maximizing revenue opportunities. You‚Äôll work closely with our product team and our portfolio companies‚Äô internal teams. If you are passionate about creating impactful designs that attract and engage users, while optimizing for business growth, we would love to have you on our team.What Youll DoLearn about our portfolio companies markets and their user demographics: Gain a deep understanding of the markets in which our portfolio companies operate and familiarize yourself with the unique characteristics and preferences of their target audiences. This knowledge will help you create designs that effectively resonate with and engage their specific user demographics.Bring portfolio companies brands, platforms, and websites (marketing and e-commerce) to the next level: Elevate the visual identity and user experience of our portfolio companies brands and websites. Collaborate with the growth marketing teams to develop design strategies that align with their overall goals and enhance brand recognition, while ensuring a cohesive and seamless user experience across all touchpoints.Create landing pages, user acquisition flows, and SEO pages: Design compelling landing pages and user surveys and quizzes that drive conversions and capture leads. Utilize your understanding of SEO best practices to optimize the website pages for search engine visibility and improve organic traffic. Ensure that the landing pages and SEO pages are visually appealing, user-friendly, and aligned with the marketing objectives of the portfolio companies.Collaborate with the portfolio companies‚Äô CEOs and product teams to conduct A/B testing of different design solutions. Use data-driven insights to evaluate the performance of various designs, iterate on them, and refine the user experience. By continuously experimenting and optimizing, you will contribute to improving conversion rates and overall user engagement.Conduct usability tests to gather feedback on the usability and intuitiveness of website designs. Conduct user interviews to gain insights into user behavior, preferences, and pain points. Apply the insights gathered from these activities to refine and enhance the user experience, ensuring that the designs effectively meet the needs and expectations of the target audience.Leverage AI and tools to support your design and research efforts. This may include using AI-powered analytics tools to gain insights from user data, utilizing AI-driven design tools to automate repetitive tasks, or employing AI-based algorithms to personalize user experiences. Stay up-to-date with emerging AI trends and incorporate them into your design process to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.Who You AreYou are humble. You operate with intellectual honesty and check our egos at the door. You are receptive, adaptable, and we help each other succeed. You are fast. You optimize for speed of learning, execution, and growth. You do not get blocked easily. You are data-driven. You trust data over intuition. You don‚Äôt guess. You engineer.You are an overachiever. You partner with CEOs as cofounders and go all in. You know start-up life is not 9-5 and that excites you. You drive your own accountability and take pride in doing great work. A win for a portfolio company is a win for Mechanism.You play the long game. You do the things today that will help us tomorrow. You optimize for the long-term enterprise value (EV) of Mechanism portfolio companies and know significant companies take years to build.You are passionate. You actively promote a positive, high-energy culture of high performance, connection, and trust. You believe life is short, so you enjoy it and do what you love.What Youll BringProven experience as a Growth Designer, preferably in a revenue-focused or marketing-driven environment.Experience with Google Analytics and design tools such as Figma, Adobe CS, and FullStory. Strong understanding of UX/UI principles and ability to create visually appealing, user-friendly designs that align with marketing goals.Knowledge of responsive design principles and experience in designing websites for optimal performance across various devices and screen sizes.Solid understanding of SEO principles and best practices and the ability to implement SEO strategies into website designs.Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, content, and development teams.Strong analytical skills and a data-driven mindset to evaluate the effectiveness of designs and make data-informed optimizations.Ability to context switch effectively and manage multiple projects simultaneously.A keen eye for detail and a passion for staying up-to-date with industry trends and emerging design techniques.Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with the ability to collaborate effectively with developers for seamless implementation.Location and Time CommitmentWe are fully remote - you can work wherever you‚Äôre most productive. This role is freelance, and meetings will need to overlap with US EST.

title: Multimedia Designer
description: The Association of Proposal Management Professionals (APMP) Marketing Department is hiring a creative and detail-oriented Multimedia Designer responsible for the creative and visual production of quality, creative storytelling using the Adobe Creative Suite.As a Multimedia Designer, you will play a crucial role in creating visually compelling and engaging multimedia content to support our marketing and communication initiatives, both online and offline. You will be both a graphic designer and a video producer.About the OrganizationThe Association of Proposal Management Association represents 12,000+ bid, capture, and business development professionals who identify, write, manage, or service bids for their organizations. APMP members are responsible for winning new work for their organizations, and its members are seen as a primarily economic engine in their company. APMP is a U.S.-based non-profit association with 29 chapters worldwide. APMP was formed in 1989.APMP operates in a 100% virtual environment, which means this position often operates independently. This position reports to a supervisor who lives and works in the United States (in the Central Standard Time zone)Multimedia Designer Responsibilities: Design and develop multimedia assets: Utilize your creative skills and expertise in multimedia design to conceptualize, design, and produce a wide range of multimedia assets, including but not limited to icons, graphics, illustrations, animations, videos, and infographics. Visual storytelling: Develop visual narratives that effectively convey key messages, brand identity, and product features through compelling multimedia content. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project goals and objectives and transform them into visually appealing and impactful designs. Brand consistency: Ensure that all multimedia designs adhere to brand guidelines and visual standards, maintaining a consistent and cohesive brand presence across various platforms and channels. Implement design elements that enhance brand recognition and resonate with our target audience. Multimedia production: Use industry-standard software and tools to create and edit multimedia content. This includes graphic design software, video editing software, animation software, and other relevant tools to produce high-quality deliverables. Collaboration and communication: Work closely with the marketing team and other stakeholders to understand project requirements, provide creative input, and deliver projects within established timelines. Effectively communicate ideas and collaborate on multimedia projects to ensure alignment with overall marketing strategies. Project management and deadlines: Manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks with your supervisor, and meet project deadlines without compromising quality. Ensure efficient workflow and effective time management to deliver high-quality multimedia assets on time. Multimedia Designer Requirements: At least three years‚Äô experience in a similar role. You must have a portfolio of multimedia design content showcasing your skills and experience to be considered for this position. In-depth knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro, After Effects). Strong creative skills with the ability to develop compelling visual narratives and translate complex ideas into visually appealing designs. An eye for aesthetics, composition, color, and typography. Ability to collaborate on long-term projects. Excellent knowledge of storyboarding and visual design principles.. Artistic with an eye for aesthetics and visually appealing content. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Compensation:‚Ç¨52,000/year or ¬£45,000/year

title: Product Designer, Growth
description: Loom is the video communication platform for async work that helps companies communicate better at scale. Loom makes it easy to record quick videos of your screen and camera and instantly share them with a link. More than 14M users across more than 200k companies around the world trust Loom to share feedback, updates, intros, training, and more ‚Äì every day. Founded in late 2015, Loom has raised $203M from world-class investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Sequoia, Kleiner Perkins, Iconic, and Coatue.Loom DesignDesign is a vital organization at Loom. By radically improving the experience of recording and sharing quick video messages, we are creating a new and more humane way of communicating at work. This requires us to think big and to discover and explore uncharted territory. Thats why were focused on building a diverse, and resilient design organization, full of talented people who love feedback and collaboration. Loom is a remote-first company, and Design is no exception: were hiring the best Designers, Researchers, and Writers from around the world, wherever they are. The RoleWe‚Äôre hiring a Product Designer to help design the future of Loom as we grow our user base. Growth Product Designers work on initiatives that increase the amount of creators, viewers, and teams on Loom ‚Äì empowering millions of people to communicate faster and more effectively at work. You will be a part of a tight-knit team, delivering massive value through both small, iterative tests and foundational, vision projects. Some examples of the work you will be doing are improvements to our new user onboarding, increasing team invites, and helping users build a habit with Loom. You‚Äôll partner with every team across Product, Design, Marketing, and Engineering to help drive activation, engagements and team expansion. You will define best practices, design for challenges both big and small, and lay the foundations for our product for years to come. Responsibilities Design delightful and educational onboarding experiences that give people the confidence, context and understanding to record and share their first Looms. Educating users how to form a habit of communicating with video at work through nudges and other educational levers Carve paths for teams and individuals to easily invite and engage with teammates on loom Simplify our roles and self-serve funnel to drive monetization amongst individuals and teams Help drive our core metrics for activation, engagement, acquisition, and monetization Be a key part of a well-rounded team of Design, PM and Engineering. Contribute to the Lens Design System Work cross-functionally with Product and Engineering partners to represent the design team, and give feedback in critique, roadmapping, sprint planning, and product and design Slack channels. Help Recruit and interview new Product Designers, and actively improve our inclusive design hiring process. What Were Looking For Experience in Product Design organizations that have shipped software to users, working closely with Product and Engineering teammates to develop the strategy and rationale for features. Demonstrable experience working with data, conducting and measuring product design experiments, and a passion for setting and achieving OKRs and metrics that materially impact the business. An outstanding portfolio, with presentable case studies showcasing a foundation in typography, interaction and visual design, product sense, and idea generation. Experience collaborating with a diverse team in a rapid growth environment. Huge plus if you‚Äôve worked with remote teammates and understand the communication patterns of working with highly distributed teams. A learning and growth mindset: We‚Äôre an early-stage startup, and we‚Äôre growing quickly. Our team size and our design process will evolve and change many times over the next few years. We strive to continuously improve, iterate, and integrate what we learn ‚Äî from our work and with each other. Experience with prototyping as a means to explore and convey design solutions. Empathy and resilience: empathy for our customers, to build a product and a service they‚Äôll love. Empathy for our coworkers, to build a workplace we‚Äôll love. Resilience to be able to take feedback from anywhere, consider it gracefully, and fold it into your thinking and your work. Excellent written, verbal, and storytelling skills How We WorkFreedom and Flexibility: At Loom, we believe work is an act, not a place. When we disengage work from a location, we can accommodate a broad range of life choices. You can choose to work from home or while you travel. We are able to hire across the United States and are continuing to expand our international presence. And you are free to move within a country without any adjustment to compensation. Engaging Workday: The key to an engaging workday is finding the right balance between different ways to work sync, async, text and video. Loom makes it easier for us to say what we mean without having to schedule a zoom meeting or struggle to find the right words. And using async communication allows us to free up time for deep work every day. We believe theres a place for sync time - often a conversation on Zoom is exactly what is needed. For team meetings, this ‚Äòsync time‚Äô is typically between 9AM-Noon PT given where the overlap of timezones where Loommates are located.Work-Rest Balance: The way we balance the fast-paced demands of a high-growth startup and sustainability is making rest a priority. We offer a flexible PTO policy so youre able to take time off when you need it. We also go fully offline for Summer Break around 4th of July and between Christmas and New Years. Rest is also part of the workday, not just during PTO. Taking a break for personal commitments, whether its watching the kids or getting some exercise is a natural part of the workday.Social Connection: Relationships and connectedness matter. We are intentional about building trust and relationships through unique, shared experiences. Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether its through Looms celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. Loommates are able to meet in person with their teams at least twice a year purely for fun. We have also built local offices for those who want to work or meet in person, starting with San Francisco and New York City.Perks at Loom Competitive compensation and equity package 99% company paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents (for US employees) Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (DCFSA) Healthcare reimbursement (for International employees) Life, AD&D, Short and Long Term Disability Insurance 401(k) with 4% company matching Professional development reimbursement Wellness stipends Unlimited PTO Paid parental leave Remote work opportunities Home office & technology reimbursement Loom = Equal Opportunity EmployerWe are actively seeking to create a diverse work environment because teams are stronger with different perspectives and experiences.We value a diverse workplace and encourage women, people of color, LGBTQIA individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, older members of society, and others from minority groups and diverse backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. All employees and contractors of Loom are responsible for maintaining a work culture free from discrimination and harassment by treating others with kindness and respect.

title: Product/Marketing Designer for SaaS App

title: UX Design Lead (Freelance)
description: Join us in shaping a unified learning experience for an enterprise software company.About Studio Malag√≥n:Studio Malag√≥n is a visual design and branding studio, driven by ideas and experiences that inspire. title: Senior product designer
description: About BurqBurq started with an ambitious mission: how can we turn the complex process of offering delivery into a simple turnkey solution.We started with building the largest network of delivery networks, partnering with some of the biggest delivery companies. Now, we‚Äôre powering deliveries for some of the fastest-growing companies from retailers to startups.It‚Äôs a big mission and now we want you to join us to make it even bigger! üöÄWe‚Äôre already backed by some of the Valleys leading venture capitalists, including Village Global, the fund whose investors include Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, Mark Zuckerberg, Reid Hoffman, and Sara Blakely. We have assembled a world-class team all over the U.S.We operate at scale, but were still a small team relative to the opportunity. We have a staggering amount of work ahead. A passion for learning new software design trends/technologies.

title: Senior User Interface Designer
description: Position SummaryThe Senior User Interface Designer is a senior role within the UI/UX Job Family focusing on delivering best-in-class user experiences for our internal and external users. This position plays an instrumental role in the technical components of the UI/UX Designs, ensuring the smooth user experiences can easily be translated into technical code and capabilities. This role serves as a senior technical role, able to translate complex designs and concepts into streamlined designs and capabilities. As a Senior User Interface Designer, you will be viewed as a subject matter expert and specialist in this field.About The TeamAs a Senior Digital Designer, you will be a key member of our innovative, nascent design team. In this role, you will be working closely with a cross-functional team of developers, product managers, and customer experience specialists to design digital systems and products that meet the evolving needs of our customers. You will have the opportunity to lead the design direction for a variety of exciting projects and bring your creative vision to life. From developing user-centered websites and mobile apps, to formalizing design systems and component libraries, you will be at the forefront of shaping the way we educate, motivate, inform, and deliver on our customer-centered values. Your work will have a significant impact on the success of our products and our ability to deliver exceptional customer experiences.Primary Qualifications Experience and knowledge of UX principles, methodologies, and design best practices. This includes user centered design and accessibility standards. Creates wireframes, design specifications, prototypes, and user flow diagrams that articulate complex user journeys across multiple webpages, touchpoints, and platforms. Experience converting complex business processes into simple, logical, easy to use systems and skilled in page design, organization, and structure of content. Works alongside product and development team to define user requirements. Ensures design standards and guidelines are maintained and shared with development teams to guide product design. Professional level knowledge of industry-standard design software (Figma, Adobe Creative Suites) Experience in responsive frontend development (HTML, CSS, Sass, etc.) and frameworks/libraries or design systems (Material Design, etc.). Sufficient understanding of project management approaches, tools and phases of the delivery lifecycle (Scrum, Kanban, Lean) and experience in JIRA, Confluence, or equivalent documentation tools. Strong active listening and collaboration skills. Ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal. Must be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through others. Desired Skills 4+ years recent experience in visual design craftsmanship, combined with a keen ability to anticipate and address user needs. Help teams apply usability and design processes and tools in support of projects and initiatives. Effective problem solver with demonstrated ability to develop creative solutions that are both functional and visually appealing. Experience with both public facing and internally facing web applications. Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations. Resilient and tenacious with a propensity to persevere. Ability to engage with others to cultivate an environment of learning and constructive collaboration. Ability to prioritize and manage work, adhering to critical project timelines. Problem solving and root cause identification skills. Superior relationship-building with a strong and approachable communication style to work effectively within cross functional teams and with all levels of the organization. Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal. Advocate and evangelize user centered design and research best practices. Conduct end to end design reviews with project teams. Consider existing insights, technical constraints, business needs, and specific platform demands to produce user centered, data driven, and design focused solutions. Play an active role in partnering with cross-functional team members in leading cohesive design standards and best practices across the enterprise. Mentor and coach Team Members on usability and design best practices. Create and provide tools that help guide teams on their journey to usable and intuitive design. Why Clayton Homes?Founded in 1956, Clayton is a Berkshire Hathaway Company committed to opening doors to a better life and Building Happyness¬Æ through homeownership. Through its family of brands, Clayton builds, sells, finances, and insures traditional site-built homes and off-site built housing ‚Äì including modular homes, manufactured homes, CrossMod‚Ñ¢ homes, tiny homes, college dormitories, military barracks, and apartments. Corporate headquarters is located in the Knoxville, Tennessee area, specifically, Maryville, Tennessee. Clayton is the recipient of numerous industry awards including 2019 Builder of the Year and ranks as the #2 builder of homes in the U.S. by units sold. Our site-built division, Clayton Properties Group, is the 8th largest site builder in the U.S. We achieve our results through the strength of our people and have been recognized on the 2021 Forbes Best Employers for Diversity and 2021 Forbes America‚Äôs Best Employers Lists. To learn more about Clayton Homes, got to: https://www.claytonhomes.comBenefits Competitive benefits including 401(k) with 100% company match of the first 4%; medical, dental and vision plans; paid time off days and holidays. Quarterly bonus program. Forbes lists: America‚Äôs Best Employers, America‚Äôs Employers by State, Best Employers for Diversity, Best Employers for Women. Recognized as one of East Tennessee‚Äôs top technology workplaces. Wellness programs that focus on emotional, social, spiritual, intellectual, environmental, physical, and financial well-being. Onsite fitness facility with full gym, workout classes, volleyball and basketball, ping-pong, and disc golf course. Paid Time Off for Volunteer work.
